Typealiases.html#/s:12BoseWearable15Sens.name: SensorTimestamp
Typealiases.html#/s:12BoseWearable15Sens.abstract: Indicates a timestamp, in milliseconds, associated with a sensor reading or gesture event. As this is an unsigned 16-bit value, a timestamp will roll over every 65.536 seconds.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: majorVersion
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Indicates the major version of the wearable sensors specification supported by this product.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: minorVersion
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Indicates the minor version of the wearable sensors specification supported by this product.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: availableSensors
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Indicates which sensors are available in this product.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: availableGestures
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Indicates which gestures are available in this product.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: transmissionPeriod
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Indicates how often samples are transmitted from the product over the air. This period is indicated in milliseconds.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: maximumPayloadPerTransmissionPeriod
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Indicates the maximum payload size of all combined active sensors that can be sent every transmission period.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: maximumActiveSensors
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Indicates the maximum number of sensors that can be active simultaneously.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.name: deviceStatus
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html#/.abstract: Provides status information about the wearable device.

Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.name: availableSensors
Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: An array of sensors that are available on this wearable device.

Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.name: scaledValueRange(for:)
Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: The range of scaled values for the specified sensor. Used in conjunction with the rawValueRange to convert incoming sensor values from integral values to floating-point values.

Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.name: rawValueRange(for:)
Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: The range of raw values for the specified sensor. Used in conjunction with the scaledValueRange to convert incoming sensor values from integral values to floating-point values.

Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.name: availableSamplePeriods(for:)
Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Identifies which sample periods are available for use with the specified sensor.

Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.name: availableSamplePeriods
Structs/SensorInformation.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Identifies which sample periods are available for use with all available sensors

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.name: enabledSensorsSamplePeriod
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: Returns the sample period for enabled sensors, if any sensors are enabled. If no sensors are enabled, returns nil.

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.name: isEnabled(sensor:)
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: Returns true if the specified sensor is defined in this sensor configuration object and has a non-zero sample period. Returns false otherwise.

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.name: samplePeriod(for:)
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: Returns the sample period, in milliseconds, for the specified sensor. Returns 0 if the specified sensor is disabled or is not defined in this sensor configuration object.

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.name: allSensors
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: An array containing all of the sensors defined in this sensor configuration object.

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.name: enabledSensors
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: An array containing the currently enabled sensors.

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.name: disabledSensors
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: An array containing the currently disabled sensors.

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.name: enable(sensor:at:)
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: Enables the specified sensor at the specified sample period. Note that all sensors must have the same sample period. Thus, if other sensors are enabled at a different sample period, this function changes all enabled sensors to use the specified sample period.

Structs/GestureInformation.html#/s:12Bos.name: availableGestures
Structs/GestureInformation.html#/s:12Bos.abstract: An array of gestures that are available on this wearable device.

Structs/GestureConfiguration.html#/s:12B.name: isEnabled(gesture:)
Structs/GestureConfiguration.html#/s:12B.abstract: Returns true if the specified gesture is enabled. Returns false otherwise.

Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: suspensionReason
Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: Indicates the suspension reason. This value is only valid if contains(.wearableSensorServiceSuspended) is true.

Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: pairingEnabled
Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: When set, indicates that pairing mode is currently enabled on the device.

Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: secureBLEPairingRequired
Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: When set, indicates that the device requires secure BLE pairing to be performed prior to accessing other encrypted characteristics.

Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: alreadyPairedToClient
Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: When set, indicates that the device has been previously paired to the client reading this characteristic.

Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: wearableSensorsServiceSuspended
Structs/DeviceStatus.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: When set, indicates that the wearable sensors service is temporarily suspended to allow other Bose services to send their data.

Structs/FirmwareVersion.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: updateStatus
Structs/FirmwareVersion.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates whether a firmware update is available.

Structs/FirmwareVersion.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: firmwareUpdateApp
Structs/FirmwareVersion.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates the app to be used to update firmware.

Structs/SensorValue.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: timestamp
Structs/SensorValue.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: The wearable device’s timestamp indicating when this reading was generated.

Structs/SensorValue.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: sample
Structs/SensorValue.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: The actual IMU sample for this reading.

Structs/SensorIntent.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: samplePeriods
Structs/SensorIntent.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: The sample periods that will be used.

Structs/SensorIntent.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: init(sensors:samplePeriods:)
Structs/SensorIntent.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: Creates a new sensor intent with the specified sensors and sample periods.

Structs/SensorData.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: values
Structs/SensorData.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: The sensor values that were contained in this update.

Structs/QuaternionAccuracy.html#/s:12Bos.name: estimatedAccuracy
Structs/QuaternionAccuracy.html#/s:12Bos.abstract: The estimated accuracy of a quaternion reading, in radians.

Structs/QuaternionAccuracy.html#/s:12Bos.name: init(estimatedAccuracy:)
Structs/QuaternionAccuracy.html#/s:12Bos.abstract: Creates a new QuaternionAccuracy instance with the specified estimated accuracy.

Structs/GestureIntent.html#/s:12BoseWear.name: init(gestures:)
Structs/GestureIntent.html#/s:12BoseWear.abstract: Creates a new gesture intent with the specified gestures.

Structs/GestureData.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: timestamp
Structs/GestureData.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: The wearable device’s timestamp indicating when this gesture was detected.

Structs/GestureData.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: payload
Structs/GestureData.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: The gesture payload. If the gesture has no payload, this value will be empty.

Structs/GestureData.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: init(gesture:timestamp:payload:)
Structs/GestureData.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: Creates a new GestureData object with the specified values.

Structs/SecurePairingInfo/Asset.html#/s:.name: image(source:)
Structs/SecurePairingInfo/Asset.html#/s:.abstract: An image asset with the associated source URL. This will be a local file URL.

Structs/SecurePairingInfo/Asset.html#/s:.name: video(source:)
Structs/SecurePairingInfo/Asset.html#/s:.abstract: A video asset with the associated source URL. This will be a remote URL.

Structs/SecurePairingInfo/Asset.html.name: Asset
Structs/SecurePairingInfo/Asset.html.abstract: Asset type, either an image or a video, with an associated source URL.

Structs/SecurePairingInfo.html#/s:12Bose.name: productId
Structs/SecurePairingInfo.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: The product ID for the device being paired.

Structs/SecurePairingInfo.html#/s:12Bose.name: variant
Structs/SecurePairingInfo.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: The variant for the device being paired.

Structs/ActiveNoiseReduction.html#/s:12B.name: isAvailable(mode:)
Structs/ActiveNoiseReduction.html#/s:12B.abstract: Returns whether the specified mode is available.

Structs/ActiveNoiseReduction.html.name: ActiveNoiseReduction
Structs/ActiveNoiseReduction.html.abstract: Encapsulates the active noise reduction (ANR) settings of a Bose device.

Structs/ControllableNoiseCancellation.ht.name: ControllableNoiseCancellation
Structs/ControllableNoiseCancellation.ht.abstract: Encapsulates the controllable noise cancellation (CNC) settings of a Bose device.

Structs/SecurePairingInfo.html.name: SecurePairingInfo
Structs/SecurePairingInfo.html.abstract: Specifies the information to be displayed in the secure pairing user interface.

Structs/GestureData.html.name: GestureData
Structs/GestureData.html.abstract: Represents a gesture event received from the remote wearable device.

Structs/GestureIntent.html.name: GestureIntent
Structs/GestureIntent.html.abstract: Declares the gestures that will be used during the lifetime of the session.

Structs/QuaternionAccuracy.html.name: QuaternionAccuracy
Structs/QuaternionAccuracy.html.abstract: The accuracy of a quaternion sensor reading, in radians.

Structs/SensorData.html.name: SensorData
Structs/SensorData.html.abstract: Represents a collection of sensor values received in a single update from the remote wearable device.

Structs/SensorIntent.html.name: SensorIntent
Structs/SensorIntent.html.abstract: Declares the sensors and sample periods that will be used during the lifetime of the session.

Structs/SensorValue.html.name: SensorValue
Structs/SensorValue.html.abstract: An individual sensor reading received from a wearable device.

Structs/DeviceStatus.html.name: DeviceStatus
Structs/DeviceStatus.html.abstract: Provides status information about a wearable device.

Structs/GestureConfiguration.html.name: GestureConfiguration
Structs/GestureConfiguration.html.abstract: The gesture configuration indicates which gestures are enabled and which are disabled. The wearable device will send gesture configuration values as its configuration changes. Client applications can configure the wearable device by changing the gesture configuration.

Structs/SensorConfiguration.html.name: SensorConfiguration
Structs/SensorConfiguration.html.abstract: The sensor configuration indicates which sensors are enabled, which are disabled, and what the current sample period is. The wearable device will send sensor configuration values as its configuration changes. Client applications can configure the wearable device by changing the sensor configuration.

Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html.name: WearableDeviceInformation
Structs/WearableDeviceInformation.html.abstract: The wearable device information provides details about the capabilities available in a particular wearable device.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionPairingDe.name: sessionRequiresPairingMode(_:)
Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionPairingDe.abstract: Indicates that the remote device must be put into pairing mode in order to continue the connection process.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionPairingDe.name: session(_:finishedPairingWithResult:)
Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionPairingDe.abstract: Indicates that the pairing process has completed with the specified result.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionDelegate..name: session(_:didFailToOpenWithError:)
Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionDelegate..abstract: Indicates that the session failed to open.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionDelegate..name: session(_:didCloseWithError:)
Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionDelegate..abstract: Indicates that the session was closed. If the specified error is nil, the session closed normally. Otherwise, the error indicates the cause for the closure.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.name: pairingDelegate
Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.abstract: The pairing delegate gets notified when a device is required to be put into pairing mode in order to proceed with the connection. This is only required if you are implementing a custom connection UI.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.name: delegate
Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.abstract: The delegate gets notified of connection-related events.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.name: device
Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.abstract: The wearable device. If there was an error opening the session, this will be nil.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.name: open()
Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.abstract: Opens the connection and establishes communications with the wearable device. Note that attempting to open a session that is not closed results in a fatal error.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.name: close()
Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html#/s:.abstract: Closes the connection and terminates communications with the wearable device.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: name
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: The name of the device.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: firmwareVersion
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Provides information about the firmware version currently installed on the device.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: deviceInformation
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Device information, as reported by the GATT device information service. When this value is updated, a WearableDeviceEvent.didUpdateDeviceInformation(DeviceInformation) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: refreshDeviceInformation()
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Refreshes the device information. When the new value is received, the deviceInformation property is updated.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: wearableDeviceInformation
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Wearable device information. When this value is updated, a WearableDeviceEvent.didUpdateWearableDeviceInformation(WearableDeviceInformation) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: refreshWearableDeviceInformation()
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Refreshes the wearable device information. When the new value is received, the wearableDeviceInformation property is updated.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: sensorInformation
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Information about the sensors provided by the wearable device. When this value is updated, a WearableDeviceEvent.didUpdateSensorInformation(SensorInformation) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: refreshSensorInformation()
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Refreshes the sensor information. When the new value is received, the sensorInformation property is updated.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: sensorConfiguration
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: The configuration of the sensors provided by the wearable device. When this value is updated, a WearableDeviceEvent.didUpdateSensorConfiguration(SensorConfiguration) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: refreshSensorConfiguration()
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Refreshes the sensor configuration. When a new value is received, the sensorConfiguration property is updated.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: changeSensorConfiguration(_:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Requests a change to the current sensor configuration. When this function is called, the specified sensor configuration value is written to the remote device. If the remote device accepts the new configuration, the sensorConfiguration property is updated. If the remote device rejects the new configuration, a WearableDeviceEvent.didFailToWriteSensorConfiguration(Error) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: gestureInformation
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Information about the gestures provided by the wearable device. When this value is updated, a WearableDeviceEvent.didUpdateGestureInformation(GestureInformation) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: refreshGestureInformation()
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Refreshes the gesture information. When a new value is received, the gestureInformation property is updated.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: gestureConfiguration
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: The configuration of the gesture recognition facility provided by the wearable device. When this value is updated, a WearableDeviceEvent.didUpdateGestureConfiguration(GestureConfiguration) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: refreshGestureConfiguration()
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Refreshes the gesture configuration. When a new value is received, the gestureConfiguration property is updated.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: changeGestureConfiguration(_:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Requests a change to the current gesture configuration. When this function is called, the specified gesture configuration value is written to the remote device. If the remote device accepts the new configuration, the gestureConfiguration property is updated. If the remote device rejects the new configuration, a WearableDeviceEvent.didFailToWriteGestureConfiguration(Error) event is fired.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: isWearableSensorServiceSuspended
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Indicates whether the wearable sensor service is suspended. On certain devices, certain user-initiated activities cause the wearable sensor service to be suspended due to bandwidth or processing restrictions.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: validateIntents(sensor:gesture:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Check if the device satisfies the intended sensor and gesture usage.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: getControllableNoiseCancellation(completionHandler:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Retrieves the current controllable noise cancellation settings from the device. The provided completion handler will be invoked with either the current controllable noise cancellation settings or an error indicating a failure.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: setControllableNoiseCancellation(level:isEnabled:completionHandler:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Sets the controllable noise cancellation level. The provided completion handler will be invoked with either the new controllable noise cancellation settings or an error indicating a failure.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: getActiveNoiseReduction(completionHandler:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Retrieves the current active noise reduction settings from the device. The provided completion handler will be invoked with either the current active noise reduction settings or an error indicating a failure.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: setActiveNoiseReduction(mode:completionHandler:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Sets the active noise reduction mode. The provided completion handler will be invoked with either the new active noise reduction settings or an error indicating a failure.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: WearableDeviceEventHandler
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Callback type that receives a WearableDeviceEvent.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: addEventListener(queue:handler:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Registers a handler block to be executed on the specified queue whenever a WearableDeviceEvent is posted from this WearableDevice object.

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: configureSensors(_:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Configure the sensors on a wearable device. The caller provides a block to this function that takes a SensorConfiguration value. The current SensorConfiguration is passed to the block which is executed synchronously on the calling thread. That SensorConfiguration value can be modified to match the desired configuration. Once the block returns, that updated configuration is then sent to the wearable device (via WearableDevice.changeSensorConfiguration(_:)).

Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.name: configureGestures(_:)
Protocols/WearableDevice.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Configure the gestures on a wearable device. The caller provides a block to this function that takes a GestureConfiguration value. The current GestureConfiguration is passed to the block which is executed synchronously on the calling thread. That GestureConfiguration value can be modified to match the desired configuration. Once the block returns, that updated configuration is then sent to the wearable device (via WearableDevice.changeGestureConfiguration(_:)).

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedSensorData(_:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that aggregated sensor data has been received. This is useful if you need to tie together the various readings received in a single update.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedAccelerometer(vector:accuracy:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that an accelerometer reading has been received.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedGyroscope(vector:accuracy:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that a gyroscope reading has been received.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedRotation(quaternion:accuracy:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that a rotation reading has been received.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedGameRotation(quaternion:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that a game rotation reading has been received.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedOrientation(vector:accuracy:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that an orientation reading has been received.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedMagnetometer(vector:accuracy:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that a magnetometer reading has been received.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedUncalibratedMagnetometer(vector:bias:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that an uncalibrated magnetometer reading has been received.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.name: receivedGesture(type:timestamp:)
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html#/s:.abstract: Indicates that a gesture has been received.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterfaceD.name: selected(device:)
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterfaceD.abstract: Indicates that the user selected the specified device.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterfaceD.name: cancelled()
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterfaceD.abstract: Indicates that the user cancelled the device search.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..name: delegate
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..abstract: The delegate gets called by the user interface to notify when devices are selected or when the search has been cancelled.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..name: add(device:signalStrength:)
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..abstract: Add the specified device with the specified signal strength to the user interface.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..name: update(device:signalStrength:)
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..abstract: Update the specified device with the specified signal strength to the user interface.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..name: remove(device:)
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..abstract: Remove the specified device from the user interface.

Protocols/SearchUIDelegate.html#/s:12Bos.name: searchUI(_:selectedDevice:)
Protocols/SearchUIDelegate.html#/s:12Bos.abstract: Indicates that the user selected the specified device.

Protocols/SearchUIDelegate.html#/s:12Bos.name: searchUICancelled(_:)
Protocols/SearchUIDelegate.html#/s:12Bos.abstract: Indicates that the user cancelled the search user interface.

Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: searchDelegate
Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Used to report user interface events back to the caller

Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: add(device:state:)
Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Add the specified device with the specified state to the user interface.

Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: update(device:state:)
Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Update the specified device to show the specified state in the user interface.

Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: remove(device:)
Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Remove the specified device from the user interface.

Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: removeAllDevices()
Protocols/SearchUI.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Remove all devices from the user interface.

Protocols/InfoUIDelegate.html#/s:12BoseW.name: infoUICancelled(_:)
Protocols/InfoUIDelegate.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Indicates that the user cancelled the info user interface.

Protocols/InfoUI.html#/s:12BoseWearable6.name: infoDelegate
Protocols/InfoUI.html#/s:12BoseWearable6.abstract: Used to report user interface events back to the caller

Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: SearchUIImpl
Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: The SearchUI type provided by the connect UI implementation.

Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: AlertUIImpl
Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: The AlertUI type provided by the connect UI implementation.

Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: InfoUIImpl
Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: The InfoUI type provided by the connect UI implementation.

Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: start()
Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: Start the user interface. Provides the opportunity to load UI, present windows, etc.

Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: finish()
Protocols/ConnectUI.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: Clean up. Dismiss and remove any user interface that was presented by this object.

Protocols/AlertUI.html#/s:12BoseWearable.name: create(icon:title:message:actions:)
Protocols/AlertUI.html#/s:12BoseWearable.abstract: Creates a new alert with the specified elements.

Protocols/AlertUI.html.name: AlertUI
Protocols/AlertUI.html.abstract: User interface to present an alert to the user.

Protocols/ConnectUI.html.name: ConnectUI
Protocols/ConnectUI.html.abstract: Objects conforming to this protocol provide a user interface front-end for a ConnectTask instance. This protocol represents a coordinator that creates, shows, and dismisses various user interface elements.

Protocols.html#/s:12BoseWearable16Connec.name: ConnectUIElement
Protocols.html#/s:12BoseWearable16Connec.abstract: Super-type of the various connect UI elements.

Protocols/InfoUI.html.name: InfoUI
Protocols/InfoUI.html.abstract: User interface to present information to the user.

Protocols/InfoUIDelegate.html.name: InfoUIDelegate
Protocols/InfoUIDelegate.html.abstract: Allows the InfoUI instance to notify when user interface events have occurred.

Protocols/SearchUI.html.name: SearchUI
Protocols/SearchUI.html.abstract: User interface to present device search results to the user.

Protocols/SearchUIDelegate.html.name: SearchUIDelegate
Protocols/SearchUIDelegate.html.abstract: Allows the SearchUI instance to notify when user interface events have occurred.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..name: DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface..abstract: Objects conforming to this protocol provide a user interface to show devices as they are discovered and allow the user to select a device.

Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterfaceD.name: DeviceSearchTaskUserInterfaceDelegate
Protocols/DeviceSearchTaskUserInterfaceD.abstract: This protocol allows a DeviceSearchTaskUserInterface to call back to the internal device search task indicating that the user selected a device or cancelled the operation.

Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html.name: SensorDispatchHandler
Protocols/SensorDispatchHandler.html.abstract: This protocol defines functions that are called by a SensorDispatch to notify a client application that sensor data has been received. Note that default implementations of each of these functions are already provided. Thus, you need only implement the functions corresponding to the sensors you are interested in.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html.name: WearableDeviceSession
Protocols/WearableDeviceSession.html.abstract: Represents a connection with a wearable device. A WearableDeviceSession must be retained for as long as you are interested in the connection. Once a WearableDeviceSession is deallocated, the connection is automatically closed and disposed.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionDelegate..name: WearableDeviceSessionDelegate
Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionDelegate..abstract: A wearable device session delegate gets notified of connection-related events.

Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionPairingDe.name: WearableDeviceSessionPairingDelegate
Protocols/WearableDeviceSessionPairingDe.abstract: The pairing delegate gets notified when a device is required to be put into pairing mode in order to proceed with the connection. This is only required if you are implementing a custom connection UI or if you are using the deprecated BoseWearable.startDeviceSearch(mode:completionHandler:) API.

Extensions/Vector.html#/s:s5SIMD3V12Bose.name: float3
Extensions/Vector.html#/s:s5SIMD3V12Bose.abstract: Convert from double-precision floating-point values to single-precision floating-point values.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: quatf
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: Convert from double-precision floating-point values to single-precision floating-point values.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: xRotation
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: Rotation of the device around X axis, in radians.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: yRotation
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: Rotation of the device around Y axis, in radians.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: zRotation
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: Rotation of the device around Z axis, in radians.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: pitch
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: Returns right-handed rotation around the X axis defined in the Bose Wearable Coordinate System. However, it only works for the raw Quaternion coming from the device. If calibrating or mapping to a different coordinate system, derive your pitch in the new coordinate system from right-handed Quaternion.xRotation, Quaternion.yRotation, and Quaternion.zRotation.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: roll
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: Returns right-handed rotation around the Y axis defined in the Bose Wearable Coordinate System. However, it only works for the raw Quaternion coming from the device. If calibrating or mapping to a different coordinate system, derive your pitch in the new coordinate system from right-handed Quaternion.xRotation, Quaternion.yRotation, and Quaternion.zRotation.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: yaw
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: Returns right-handed rotation around the Z axis defined in the Bose Wearable Coordinate System. However, it only works for the raw Quaternion coming from the device. If calibrating or mapping to a different coordinate system, derive your pitch in the new coordinate system from right-handed Quaternion.xRotation, Quaternion.yRotation, and Quaternion.zRotation.

Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.name: debugDescription
Extensions/Quaternion.html#/s:So10simd_q.abstract: A textual description of the quaternion suitable for debugging.

Enums/SensorType.html#/s:12BoseWearable1.name: all
Enums/SensorType.html#/s:12BoseWearable1.abstract: The set of sensors supported by the SDK. See WearableDeviceInformation.availableSensors and SensorInformation.availableSensors for the set of sensors supported by a given wearable device.

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: _320ms
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Indicates that samples are sent every 320 ms (3.125 Hz)

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: _160ms
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Indicates that samples are sent every 160 ms (6.25 Hz)

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: _80ms
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Indicates that samples are sent every 80 ms (12.5 Hz)

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: _40ms
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Indicates that samples are sent every 40 ms (25 Hz)

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: _20ms
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Indicates that samples are sent every 20 ms (50 Hz)

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: _10ms
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Indicates that samples are sent every 10 ms (100 Hz)

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: _5ms
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: Indicates that samples are sent every 5 ms (200 Hz)

Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: all
Enums/SamplePeriod.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: An array of all possible sample periods.

Enums/GestureType.html#/s:12BoseWearable.name: all
Enums/GestureType.html#/s:12BoseWearable.abstract: The set of gestures supported by the SDK. See WearableDeviceInformation.availableGestures and GestureInformation.availableGestures for the set of gestures supported by a given wearable device.

Enums/WearableDeviceSessionState.html#/s.name: closed
Enums/WearableDeviceSessionState.html#/s.abstract: Indicates that the session is currently closed.

Enums/WearableDeviceSessionState.html#/s.name: opening
Enums/WearableDeviceSessionState.html#/s.abstract: Indicates that the session is currently being opened.

Enums/WearableDeviceSessionState.html#/s.name: open
Enums/WearableDeviceSessionState.html#/s.abstract: Indicates that the session is currently open.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didWriteSensorConfiguration
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that the requested change to the device’s sensor configuration succeeded. A subsequent .didUpdateSensorConfiguration event will be received with the new value.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didFailToWriteSensorConfiguration(_:)
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that a requested change to the device’s sensor configuration failed with the associated error.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didReceiveSensorData(_:)
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that sensor data was received. While it is possible to listen for these events to get sensor data, using a SensorDispatch object is recommended instead.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didWriteGestureConfiguration
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that the requested change to the device’s gesture configuration succeeded. A subsequent .didUpdateGestureConfiguration event will be received with the new value.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didFailToWriteGestureConfiguration(_:)
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that a requested change to the device’s gesture configuration failed with the associated error.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didReceiveGestureData(_:)
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that gesture data was received. While it is possible to listen for these events to get gesture data, using a SensorDispatch object is recommended instead.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didSuspendWearableSensorService(_:)
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that the wearable sensor service was suspended for the specified reason. On certain devices, certain user-initiated activities cause the wearable sensor service to be suspended due to bandwidth or processing restrictions.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.name: didResumeWearableSensorService
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Indicates that the wearable sensor service was resumed. On certain devices, certain user-initiated activities cause the wearable sensor service to be suspended due to bandwidth or processing restrictions.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: boseConnect
Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that the Bose Connect app is to be used to update the device’s firmware.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: boseMusic
Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that the Bose Music app is to be used to update the device’s firmware.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: url
Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: The URL to open (e.g., via UIApplication.open(_:options:completionHandler:)) to launch this firmware update app.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: name
Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Returns the name of the Bose App

Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.name: success(_:)
Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.abstract: The operation was successful, returning the associated value.

Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.name: failure(_:)
Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.abstract: The operation failed, with the associated value causing the failure.

Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.name: isSuccess
Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.abstract: Returns true if the result is a success, false otherwise.

Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.name: isFailure
Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.abstract: Returns true if the result is a failure, false otherwise.

Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.name: value
Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.abstract: Returns the associated value if the result is a success, nil otherwise.

Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.name: error
Enums/Result.html#/s:12BoseWearable6Resu.abstract: Returns the associated error value if the result is a failure, nil otherwise.

Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: success(_:)
Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: The operation was successful, returning the associated value.

Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: failure(_:)
Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: The operation failed, with the associated value causing the failure.

Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: isSuccess
Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Returns true if the result is a success, false otherwise.

Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: isFailure
Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Returns true if the result is a failure, false otherwise.

Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: isCancelled
Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Returns true if the result indicates a cancellation, false otherwise.

Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: value
Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Returns the associated value if the result is a success, nil otherwise.

Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: error
Enums/CancellableResult.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Returns the associated error value if the result is a failure, nil otherwise.

Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.name: invalidRequestLength
Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.abstract: The specified request is not the correct length.

Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.name: invalidSamplePeriod
Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.abstract: The requested sample period is not valid.

Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.name: invalidSensorConfiguration
Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.abstract: The requested sensor configuration is not valid.

Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.name: configExceedsMaxThroughput
Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.abstract: The requested configuration exceeds the maximum available throughput.

Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.name: wearableSensorServiceUnavailable
Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html#/.abstract: The wearable sensor service is currently unavailable.

Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html.name: ErrorCode
Enums/BoseWearableError/ErrorCode.html.abstract: Indicates an error code received from a wearable device.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: wearableDeviceError(code:underlyingError:)
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates an error response was received from a wearable device.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: invalidResponse
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates an invalid response was received from a wearable device.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: firmwareUpdateRequired(_:)
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates the device requires a firmware update to enable its usage.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: missingRequiredCharacteristic(_:)
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that the service failed to start because a required characteristic was not available.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: connectionTaskAlreadyInProgress
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that the connection task failed because it is already running.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: functionNotSupported
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that the requested function is not supported by the remote device.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: missingRequiredData
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that an operation failed because required data is not present. Indicates an internal state error.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: unrecognizedProductID(_:)
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that the device has an unrecognized product identifier.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.name: intentsNotFulfilled(sensors:samplePeriods:gestures:)
Enums/BoseWearableError.html#/s:12BoseWe.abstract: Indicates that the specified intents are not fulfilled due to the the associated unavailable sensors, sample periods, and gestures.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: accelerometer(value:accuracy:)
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: An accelerometer sample, containing a vector value and an accuracy value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: gyroscope(value:accuracy:)
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: A gyroscope sample, containing a vector value and an accuracy value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: rotation(value:accuracy:)
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: A rotation sample, containing a quaternion value and an accuracy value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: gameRotation(value:)
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: A game rotation sample, containing a quaternion.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: orientation(value:accuracy:)
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: An orientation sample, containing a vector value and an accuracy value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: magnetometer(value:accuracy:)
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: A magnetometer sample, containing a vector value and an accuracy value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: uncalibratedMagnetometer(value:bias:)
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: An uncalibrated magnetometer sample, containing a vector value and a bias value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: vector
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: The vector value associated with this sample, or nil if this sample does not provide a vector value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: vectorAccuracy
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: The vector accuracy value associated with this sample, or nil if this sample does not provide a vector accuracy value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: quaternion
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: The quaternion value associated with this sample, or nil if this sample does not provide a quaternion value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: quaternionAccuracy
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: The quaternion accuracy value associated with this sample, or nil if this sample does not provide a quaternion accuracy value.

Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.name: bias
Enums/SensorSample.html#/s:12BoseWearabl.abstract: The bias value associated with this sample, or nil if this sample does not provide a bias value.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateStatus.html#/s:12Bos.name: updateAvailable(version:)
Enums/FirmwareUpdateStatus.html#/s:12Bos.abstract: Indicates that an update is available with the specified version number.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateStatus.html#/s:12Bos.name: upToDate
Enums/FirmwareUpdateStatus.html#/s:12Bos.abstract: Indicates that the firmware is up to date.

Enums/DeviceSearchMode.html#/s:12BoseWea.name: alwaysShowUI
Enums/DeviceSearchMode.html#/s:12BoseWea.abstract: Always present a view controller to the user, allowing the user to select a device.

Enums/DeviceSearchMode.html#/s:12BoseWea.name: automaticallySelectMostRecentlyConnectedDevice(timeout:)
Enums/DeviceSearchMode.html#/s:12BoseWea.abstract: If the most-recently connected device is found before timeout elapses, this device is automatically selected. If no connected device is found before timeout elapses, the DeviceSearchTask will present user interface allowing the user to select a device.

Enums/InfoType.html#/s:12BoseWearable8In.name: securePairing(info:)
Enums/InfoType.html#/s:12BoseWearable8In.abstract: Indicates that the InfoUI instance is to show secure pairing instructions for the specified product ID.

Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:12BoseWearable.name: found(_:)
Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:12BoseWearable.abstract: Indicates that the device has been seen with the specified signal strength.

Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:12BoseWearable.name: connecting
Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:12BoseWearable.abstract: Indicates that a connection is being established.

Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:12BoseWearable.name: connected
Enums/DeviceState.html#/s:12BoseWearable.abstract: Indicates that a connection has been established.

Enums/ConnectUIMode.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: alwaysShow
Enums/ConnectUIMode.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: Always present user interface to the user, allowing the user to select a device.

Enums/ConnectUIMode.html#/s:12BoseWearab.name: connectToLast(timeout:)
Enums/ConnectUIMode.html#/s:12BoseWearab.abstract: Attempts to connect to the most-recently connected device, if one is available. If none are available, or if the most-recently connected device is not found before timeout elapses, the search user interface is shown.

Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.name: operatorNotSupported
Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.abstract: Operator is not supported for that function.

Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.name: invalidData
Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.abstract: Data values sent to remote device are incorrect.

Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.name: runTime
Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.abstract: Failure to read/write the information requested that is temporary.

Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.name: invalidState
Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.abstract: Action requested is not applicable to the current state.

Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.name: functionBlockSpecificError
Enums/DeviceProtocolErrorCode.html#/s:12.abstract: Error code is function-block specific. This value is only used internally.

Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html#/s:12Bose.name: errorCode(_:)
Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: The operation failed with the specified error code.

Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html#/s:12Bose.name: unrecognizedErrorCode(_:)
Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: The operation failed with an unrecognized error code.

Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html#/s:12Bose.name: functionBlockSpecificErrorCode(_:)
Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: The operation failed with an error code that is specific to the function being called.

Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html.name: DeviceProtocolError
Enums/DeviceProtocolError.html.abstract: Indicates a failure occurred while communicating with the remote device.

Enums/AlertIcon.html.name: AlertIcon
Enums/AlertIcon.html.abstract: This is used by an AlertUI instance to determine the icon to show in the user interface as it is presented.

Enums/ConnectUIMode.html.name: ConnectUIMode
Enums/ConnectUIMode.html.abstract: Indicates the mode of operation for the connect UI.

Enums/DeviceState.html.name: DeviceState
Enums/DeviceState.html.abstract: Indicates the state of a DiscoveredDevice during a device search.

Enums/InfoType.html.name: InfoType
Enums/InfoType.html.abstract: This is used by an InfoUI instance to determine the layout and content of the user interface as it is presented.

Enums/SignalStrength.html.name: SignalStrength
Enums/SignalStrength.html.abstract: Indicates the observed signal strength of a device suitable for display in the user interface.

Enums/DeviceSearchMode.html.name: DeviceSearchMode
Enums/DeviceSearchMode.html.abstract: Indicates the mode of operation for the device search.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateStatus.html.name: FirmwareUpdateStatus
Enums/FirmwareUpdateStatus.html.abstract: Indicates whether a firmware update is available.

Enums/SensorSample.html.name: SensorSample
Enums/SensorSample.html.abstract: An individual sensor sample. An enum is used as different sensors have provide different data formats.

Enums/VectorAccuracy.html.name: VectorAccuracy
Enums/VectorAccuracy.html.abstract: Indicates the accuracy of a given vector sample.

Enums/BoseWearableError.html.name: BoseWearableError
Enums/BoseWearableError.html.abstract: Unified error type for the BoseWearable SDK.

Enums/CancellableResult.html.name: CancellableResult
Enums/CancellableResult.html.abstract: Used to represent whether an operation was successful, was cancelled, or encountered an error.

Enums/Result.html.name: Result
Enums/Result.html.abstract: Used to represent whether an operation was successful or encountered an error.

Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html.name: FirmwareUpdateApp
Enums/FirmwareUpdateApp.html.abstract: Indicates the iOS app that can be used to update the device’s firmware.

Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html.name: WearableDeviceEvent
Enums/WearableDeviceEvent.html.abstract: Notifications of this type are fired to indicate various events related to a wearable device.

Enums/GestureType.html.name: GestureType
Enums/GestureType.html.abstract: Identifies a gesture recognized by a wearable device.

Enums/SamplePeriod.html.name: SamplePeriod
Enums/SamplePeriod.html.abstract: Indicates the sample period for a given sensor.

Enums/SensorType.html.name: SensorType
Enums/SensorType.html.abstract: Identifies a sensor in a wearable device.

Enums/SuspensionReason.html.name: SuspensionReason
Enums/SuspensionReason.html.abstract: Indicates what is causing the wearable sensor service to be suspended.

Classes/SensorDispatch.html#/s:12BoseWea.name: handler
Classes/SensorDispatch.html#/s:12BoseWea.abstract: The sensor dispatch handler. This is invoked in response to any incoming sensor data.

Classes/SensorDispatch.html#/s:12BoseWea.name: init(queue:)
Classes/SensorDispatch.html#/s:12BoseWea.abstract: Creates a new SensorDispatch object that will dispatch incoming sensor data on the specified operation queue.

Classes/SensorDispatch.html#/s:12BoseWea.name: sensorDataCallback
Classes/SensorDispatch.html#/s:12BoseWea.abstract: Callback to receive aggregated sensor data. This is useful if you need to tie together the various readings received in a single update.

Classes/DeviceSearchTask.html#/s:12BoseW.name: init(bluetoothManager:removeTimeout:mode:userInterface:completionHandler:)
Classes/DeviceSearchTask.html#/s:12BoseW.abstract: Creates a new device search task. This initializer sets self as the delegate property on the userInterface object.

Classes/AlertAction/Style.html#/s:12Bose.name: negative
Classes/AlertAction/Style.html#/s:12Bose.abstract: Presented as plain text with no background or outline

Classes/AlertAction/Style.html.name: Style
Classes/AlertAction/Style.html.abstract: Represents how and where an action should be placed in the user interface.

Classes/BoseWearable/ConfigOption.html#/.name: rssiCutoff
Classes/BoseWearable/ConfigOption.html#/.abstract: The minimum RSSI value for discovered devices. Default is -70.

Classes/BoseWearable/ConfigOption.html.name: ConfigOption
Classes/BoseWearable/ConfigOption.html.abstract: Keys for the options dictionary passed to the BoseWearable.configure(_:) function.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: bluetoothManager
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: The Bluetooth manager handles device discovery and session creation. Client applications can use this object to perform a device search with a custom user interface.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: createSimulatedWearableDeviceSession()
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: Creates a WearableDeviceSession that uses the iOS device’s internal IMU to simulate the sensor data that would be received from a Bose Wearable device. For testing purposes only.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: startConnection(mode:sensorIntent:gestureIntent:completionHandler:)
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: Begins the connection workflow for Bose devices. A UIViewController may be modally presented on a newly-created UIWindow to present a list of discovered devices. The user can select a device from this list. The mode value passed allows for already-connected devices to be automatically selected.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: startDeviceSearch(mode:completionHandler:)
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: Begins searching for devices in the specified mode. A UIViewController may be modally presented on a newly-created UIWindow to present a list of discovered devices. The user can select a device from this list. The mode value passed allows for already-connected devices to be automatically selected.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: isDeviceLoggingEnabled
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: If true, enables logging of device-level events. Default is false.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: isSensorDataLoggingEnabled
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: If true, enabled logging of sensor data. Default is false.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: isSensorLoggingEnabled
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: If true, enables logging of sensor events. Default is false.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: isServiceLoggingEnabled
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: If true, enables logging of service-level events. Default is false.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: isSessionLoggingEnabled
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: If true, enables logging of session-level events. Default is false.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: isConnectUILoggingEnabled
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: If true, enables logging of connect UI events. Default is false.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: configure(_:)
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: Initializes and configures the BoseWearable library with the specified options (if provided, otherwise default values will be used). Note this function can only be called once. Subsequent calls will result in a fatal error.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: shared
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: The shared singleton BoseWearable instance. Note that the configure(_:) method must be called before referencing this variable. Otherwise, a fatal error will be raised.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: releaseVersion
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: The release version of the BoseWearable framework. This corresponds to the CFBundleShortVersionString key in the framework’s Info.plist.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: buildNumber
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: The build number of the BoseWearable framework. This corresponds to the CFBundleVersion key in the framework’s Info.plist.

Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.name: formattedVersion
Classes/BoseWearable.html#/s:12BoseWeara.abstract: The formatted version of the BoseWearable framework, combining the release version and build number.

Classes/BoseWearable.html.name: BoseWearable
Classes/BoseWearable.html.abstract: Top-level interface to the BoseWearable library. Note that you must call BoseWearable.configure(_:) before using the BoseWearable.shared singleton instance. Failing to do so results in a fatal error.

Classes/ConnectionTask.html.name: ConnectionTask
Classes/ConnectionTask.html.abstract: Encapsulates the device search and connection functionality. It requires a ConnectUI implementation that gets called to show and update the user interface throughout the search, connect, and secure pairing process.

Classes/AlertAction.html.name: AlertAction
Classes/AlertAction.html.abstract: Encapsulates an action to be shown on an AlertUI instance.

Classes/DeviceSearchTask.html.name: DeviceSearchTask
Classes/DeviceSearchTask.html.abstract: The DeviceSearchTask class encapsulates the device search functionality. It requires a DeviceSearchUserInterface object that gets called to show and update the device picker which allows users to select a discovered device. The DeviceSearchUserInterface calls back into the DeviceSearchTask via the DeviceSearchUserInterfaceDelegate protocol.

Classes/SensorDispatch.html.name: SensorDispatch
Classes/SensorDispatch.html.abstract: A SensorDispatch object is used to receive sensor readings. A SensorDispatch object listens for the underlying WearableDeviceEvent notifications indicating that sensor data has been received. It then unpacks the individual values from the data and dispatches each to its appropriate callback block and to its handler (a SensorDispatchHandler object).

Classes.html#/s:12BoseWearable13Listener.name: ListenerToken
Classes.html#/s:12BoseWearable13Listener.abstract: An opaque token used to add and remove listeners backed by NotificationCenter. A ListenerToken object retains the token returned by NotificationCenter.addObserver(for:object:queue:) as well as the NotificationCenter. When the object is deallocated, we automatically remove the observer from the retained NotificationCenter using the retained token.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
